description: True to the origins of its name, Chamomile has gentle notes of apple, and there is a mellow, honey-like sweetness in the cup. It has a silky mouthfeel and yet remains a clean, delicately floral herbal tea, and even from the very first sip it feels wonderfully soothing. Chamomile is renowned for its sleep-inducing properties, which have led to its nickname: sleepy-time tea. It’s a natural sedative and muscle relaxant, meaning it’s the perfect cup to drink in bed to prepare for a refreshing night’s sleep.However, Chamomile tea is well-loved for many other health benefits too. It’s believed to soothe indigestion and period pain due to its muscle-relaxing properties, as well as being a natural way to boost the immune system and relieve symptoms of anxiety, making it far more than just a sleep aid.

Peppermint tea has a hint of a spicy pepper flavor, and it has a little sweetness and mint flavor.Peppermint is a minty herb native to Europe and Asia.It's an aromatic tea that can magically warm you up on a cold day or cool you down when it's hot.For hundreds of years, people have used peppermint both as a flavoring and for its medicinal properties.Peppermint tea has a number of other benefits, including curing nausea, relieving menstrual cramps and other muscle spasms, soothing skin rashes, boosting alertness, and even controlling herpes simplex. It also acts as a strong diuretic.Peppermint in particular helps to relieve stress-related symptoms such as migraine, headaches and stomach upsets.

Ginger tea is a herbal beverage that is made from ginger root.Ginger is native to Asia and is the flowering plant of the Zingiberaceae family. Its root, or stem, adds flavor to many types of cuisine, but is also an ancient herbal remedy for a host of ailments. Drinking ginger tea may help with everything from motion sickness to cancer prevention.Naturally caffeine free! So it’s perfect for drinking at night.It is pleasently spicy and warming.

Hibiscus tea, also called sour tea because of its tart taste, is made from a mixture of dried hibiscus flowers, leaves, and dark red calyces.It is delightfully fragrant, exotic, and soothing.It has a flavor profile that includes fruity, sweet, sour, and astringent notes. The tea is often compared to cranberries due to its tart yet sweet flavor. The tea is frequently brewed hot, but also makes an excellent iced tea.It is great for lowering body temperatures, and to treat heart and nerve diseases.It can also be used in the treatment of high blood pressure.
Matcha is essentially processed green tea leaves that have been stone-ground into a delicate powder.Matcha has a bright, vegetal, and slightly bitter taste, with notes of sweetness and umami.
